disease.name: Miraluka Melancholia
disease.description: Miraluka Melancholia is a psychological disorder that primarily affects individuals of the Miraluka species, characterized by persistent feelings of sadness, hopelessness, and loss of interest or pleasure in activities.

symptoms: Loss of Interest or Pleasure in Activities Once Enjoyed
Feelings of Worthlessness or Excessive Guilt

treatment_plans.name: Psychotherapy
treatment_plans.description: Provide individual or group psychotherapy sessions, such as cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) or interpersonal therapy (IPT), to help individuals explore and address underlying emotional issues, develop coping strategies, and improve mood regulation.

treatment_plans.name: Medication Management
treatment_plans.description: Prescribe antidepressant medications, such as selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors (SSRIs) or serotonin-norepinephrine reuptake inhibitors (SNRIs), to help alleviate symptoms of depression and stabilize mood.

treatment_plans.name: Lifestyle Modifications
treatment_plans.description: Encourage individuals to engage in self-care activities, maintain a healthy lifestyle, and establish a routine to promote physical and emotional well-being. This may include regular exercise, proper nutrition, adequate sleep, and stress management techniques.

treatment_plans.name: Social Support
treatment_plans.description: Foster social support networks and encourage individuals to connect with friends, family members, or support groups. Social support can provide emotional validation, practical assistance, and a sense of belonging, which can help alleviate feelings of isolation and improve mood.

treatment_plans.name: Crisis Intervention
treatment_plans.description: Provide crisis intervention services and emergency support for individuals experiencing severe symptoms or thoughts of self-harm or suicide. This may involve immediate psychiatric evaluation, safety planning, and coordination with mental health professionals.
